website_summaries.verdict: This slim front pocket wallet offers RFID protection, full-size cash storage, and other useful features generally found in higher-end models. Ideal for traveling or carrying basic ID and a few essential cards to events.
pros: High-quality leather at an entry level price point
Generous 8 card capacity, and cash does not require folding
cons: Money and receipt compartment are very small
Not as slim or minimalist as expected

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful...but does not hold up!
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look and feel of this wallet so much that I bought two more of them! Sadly, after a little over two years of light use, part of the "leather" came lose. This small section (underneath the blue credit card that is pictured in their advertisement) began to tear apart from the rest of the wallet. It made it difficult to remove my credit cards. I finally had to tear it completely off, which was very easy, since it is a VERY thin piece of leather (possibly) or a piece of fake leather (much more likely). I am disappointed, since I did liked the look and feel of this wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Slim, works great, but doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in January 2015. July of 2015 and I'm looking for a new wallet. After really liking this a lot for being very thin and easy to use, and using it all the time, it came apart at the seams after 7 months. I didn't overstuff it at all. One card per slot. And not that the whole wallet is now not functional, BUT the two main slots that I used the most are a no go. So inexpensive maybe I should just buy another one. But I'm guessing the same thing would happen again. Short version: works great, but doesn't last very long at all.
customer_reviews.author: clinn

customer_reviews.title: Holds more than you think
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one that I have purchased. The first one lasted 5 years and the leather wore nicely, the stiching on one side finally gave way. I did not hesitate to buy a replacement this one has a textured leather finish and there was no brown one to order so I got black. One thing different on this one is that they sewed a tag in one of the center pocket. This tag gets in the way when you try to store cash in that pocket. I wound up cutting this tag out. I hope to get another 5 years from this wallet. By the way I carry 10 cards and 20 bills.
customer_reviews.author: Menauhant

customer_reviews.title: Slim, Tight slots
customer_reviews.text: The slots keep my cards very secure so far (1 month in). The spots for cash are very tight to squeeze even 2 bills in, but they go in and don't fall out. I carry two gift cards, 1 credit card, 1 license, two badges for Daycare and work, and insurance ID, a 20 and a 5, and a check. This fills each spot with 1 thing, and the middle with the two badges and ins ID. I wouldn't want to put anything else in it but works great if you can keep to less than that on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: C.Feldmann

customer_reviews.title: Had a lot of promise, but proved disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about buying this wallet. When I got it, I was pleased with the look and size. I also liked how it could carry everything I needed. However it hasn't even been 6 months and already the inner seams have fallen apart, exposing the cards and making it very difficult to pull my cards in and out. I do not heavily use the product or try to force the cards in each slot, so it's not like I'm abusing this thing. My folding $20 wallet is 8 years old and has no torn seams. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Peter S

customer_reviews.title: Works well. protect your credit/debit card data.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for over a year now and finally posting a review. I think it is perfect for my purposes. I think it's important to not overload it. I keep two major credit cards, drivers license, another form of ID and two fifty dollar bills for emergency purposes. It's held up extremely well and looks good considering that I carry it in one of my front pockets every day. I expect it to last for several more years with no problem. it's also worth noting that in years past I had my bank debit card and my American Express card data stolen. I've not had another occurrence since I've been using this RFID blocking wallet.
customer_reviews.author: EKing

customer_reviews.title: Good Functional Layout but Didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: It lasted about 22 months before the side pocket seams gave out. That is daily use for a middle aged man. The price was low for this foreign leather item but I'm going to spend a bit more on a new one now. Hoping it lasts longer. The RFID blocking works but I didn't buy it for that reason. My car uses a rfid card key and it completely blocks it. If that's important to you, then this one works. I probably would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bertin

customer_reviews.title: I finally made the change!
customer_reviews.text: I was that guy with the big old wallet and finally realized I don't need all that stuff in my wallet. Half of the cards I had in my wallet I never use or I can grab when I need it (Medical Insurance, Store Loyalty Card, etc). I've been using this for a few days and love it. It's so slim and I no longer have a bulge in my front pocket. Only downside to a slim wallet is you have to neatly fold your cash to fit in the center pocket, but that's no big deal. Would recommend everyone with a fatty wallet to make the switch and the Hammer Anvil is a quality and affordable choice!
customer_reviews.author: Peter F

customer_reviews.title: Good for Cards, bad for cash - not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: Good for Cards, bad for cash. I use cash at least once a week. Over the coarse of 1 year, the stitching has come apart in the cash area. If you plan on using cash, don't buy this. This works ok for cards. The inner pockets are really hard to get the cards out of. The outer pockets can become too loose if you stretch the wallet out by putting more cards in, and then taking them back out. It works pretty good but definitely not perfect, and the quality is not super amazing in the middle cash area.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J.

customer_reviews.title: Worked very well for about a year. I probably over-stuffed it with cash and cards though.
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for. After years of simply clipping my wad of cash, cards and miscellaneous items together with a black binder-clip, I realized that I needed something better, because I was wearing holes into my front pocket. This won't hold as big a wad of $1 and $5 bills as I used to carry, and it is a bit tight, but... ***UPDATE: Yeah, I ended up abusing it by over-stuffing it with cash and cards, and the lining where the money goes started getting torn-up after about a year. What do you expect though for $10?
customer_reviews.author: Sui Juris

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet for the price
customer_reviews.text: This wallet has been great, sleek design, goat leather original. Bought these when it was 12$. Has been to hell and back. Deployed with it, swam, worked, built and hiked. This thing has been through the ringer of elements. Great wallet. Looking for something minimal in design that has great stitching this is it. Checked my order date, was for November of 2017. Time to get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Selhorn

customer_reviews.title: Awesomely priced, awesome wallet
customer_reviews.text: The wallet is a fantastic grab at this price. It’s slim and ergonomic. Fits so well in the front pocket and holds my cards snugly. However, after about 6 cards the wallet requires some force to open or move the center pockets. Which isn’t a problem except the cards end up bending in the process. That forces me to minimalize the cards I carry. Which in the end was my goal anyway. Slimmer wallet, less cards. It boasts RFID, Anti-breach tech, and I can’t test that without checking it without the technology to read the cards. Either way. Great wallet, minimalist. Feels awesome. RFID. And the price is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Very slim
customer_reviews.text: When I wear it, it doesn’t show through my jeans. It’s not bulky at all. Sometimes I double up and put 2 cards on one slot and it is still slim. It forces you to only keep what’s important on you. I keep other less important cards like store cards or rewards card in my car for easy access Incase I need it. The downside to this wallet is that, it doesn’t hold too much bills and also that it doesn’t have a spot for coins. Still a great wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Tiny Wallet
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband. He was carrying a regular bi-fold wallet in his front pocket. I thought this would take up less space in his pocket. Wow! Would it ever! He would not be able to get all his stuff in it though. So, I decided to take it and use it in my purse for my debit card that I use frequently. It doesn't hold much. The quality is good and the leather was nice.
customer_reviews.author: T.Harris

customer_reviews.title: Nice slim wallet holds plenty
customer_reviews.text: I am always on lookout for a good small wallet. This was recommended by a co-worker. I am very pleased. There are two credit cards slots on each side. Also pockets on each side for things like drivers license and insurance cards. Carrying cash has always been an issue for me with minimalist wallets. This was has a nice slot which appears to comfortably hold quite a few folded bills. Overall, I'd say this wallet is a bit wider than other small wallets I owned. But is also thinner with everything inside, which I like. I also like the blue collar, which was a pretty bold move for a traditional black wallet guy like me.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Clouston

customer_reviews.title: It's low quality and smells bad
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. And it smelled bad. It felt really cheap and wasn't very pleasant to hold. The material felt like vinyl painted on cardboard. The smell was very weird, the best way to describe it would be a chemical smell, like a garage or factory mixed with some kind of weird dead animal. Definitely a scent I don't care to remember. I was worried people would smell this odor on me if I was carrying the thing so I decided to just throw it away and chalk it up as a loss. I wouldn't recommend buying this wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Gone Fatingly

customer_reviews.title: My back no longer aches
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my large, overstuffed bi-fold wallet that I carried in my back pocket. I carry this in my front pocket. Holds about 6 cards and a fair amount of bills but if you're a Rockefeller you might want to chose something else. The RFID blocking does work, I've tested it with hotel room keys and security badges and the cards must be removed to be read.
customer_reviews.author: Hooligan Dad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for front pocket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 26 year old son for Christmas and he loves it. He wouldn't carry a wallet anymore because he hates the bulk in his back pocket and he likes to carry his money and cards in his front pocket. I was very happy when I found this style wallet so he could keep his money and cards together. I was always afraid he was going to lose his stuff. He uses this and loves it. He told me it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Burrington

customer_reviews.title: Slimmest WEDGE wallet & RFID leaks like sive
customer_reviews.text: RFID protection doesn’t seem to work.....I used it at 7/11 and paid with my pay pass not realizing it shouldn’t have worked until I got in the truck. Additionally I am able to store my key card for work in the #2 slot (from center) and it doesn’t block the RFID for security doors. It’s only slim when empty. They should have flipped one side slots 180degrees to try and eliminate the wedge formation when filled.
customer_reviews.author: N.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Wallet
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for about a year and it has held up extremely well. It's very slim and holds the perfect amount of cards and cash without creating a lot of bulk. I don't miss my bifold wallet one bit. There is no fraying or worn out leather, and the wallet's RFID blocking liner works (I have to take my metro card out of the wallet now). Fantastic value, I don't see this wallet wearing out anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: hotroddawg

customer_reviews.title: Great, compact, better than expected....
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect wallet for me. I own many credit cards but I only carry two of them (one has Costco ID) for safety reasons to prevent identity theft in case of loss. So this wallet easily holds those two plus driver's license plus miscellaneous. It's compact and perfect. It'll fit in my back pocket or even in my shirt pocket very comfortably. It is easier to get out of my back pocket when I'm sitting on it at the drive-thru. Good quality. I was skeptical as to whether it would work, but it works perfectly. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bevan

customer_reviews.title: Great Temporary/Travel Wallet Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised - would be great for someone with very few credit cards, ID and money. Unfortunately it is SO thin and small that you can really only get 4 cards (any mix of ID, Gift, Membership or Credit Cards you might have) into it before it is so tight you can't access the bills in the center without removing some of the cards. Won't truly replace a wallet, but would work if you were traveling and wanting something to Travel light! Good Quality, well made, and contrary to some other posts, mine didn't stink/smell badly.
customer_reviews.author: JimBo

customer_reviews.title: Holds up well so far with me overstuffing it
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It definitely does what it says and I stuff more than what they claim in it without any issue. It's definitely more comfortable in my pocket than a standard sized wallet. i've had it about 2 months and so far it is holding up well considering how I overstuff it.
customer_reviews.author: nascarmom29

customer_reviews.title: Great minimalist wallet!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item to use as a travel-only wallet, but ended up loving it so much that I use it full time! I didn't purchase this for the RFID blocking capability, so I can't comment on whether it works or not. I am able to fit my driver's license, 3 credit cards, a metro card, health insurance card, and about 5 bills in this wallet with absolutely zero issues...I bet it could hold more! The build quality is good, no missed stitches or loose threads. Overall I recommend this item and wouldn't hesitate to replace if it was lost or damaged.
customer_reviews.author: SNayak

customer_reviews.title: Slim, Durable. No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: No regrets. This is my first "slim wallet" and I'd only used standard leather wallets previous to this purchase. I purchased this wallet on 12/19/15 and I'm writing this review 7/18/16. Regarding the RFID Blocking, there is honestly not much I can say about that. However, this wallet seems very durable to me. At the moment I have 11 cards, 3 coins, a receipt, some cash (honestly rolled pretty messily), ..and it is all still easily accessible. When it's in my back pocket it doesn't bother my butt and it helps me to stay minimalistic with what I carry around. I'm satisfied. No regrets. :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas H

customer_reviews.title: The wallet I wish I would have always used
customer_reviews.text: Great minimalist wallet! After a strong attempt to downsize my current bi-fold, I found my old wallet was loose and cards kept sliding out. Since I don't ever carry cash on my, the amount of cards that could fit in the wallet was my primary concern. This holds all my cards firmly, is super thin, and gives me instant access to my cards, where my old wallet I had to open it. Price was right, quality seems good. I'll never buy a bi or tri-fold wallet again.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Good for a dedicated credit card only wallet.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected. Unknown if it actually blocks RF like it says it does. After about a year, the stictching has not failed, unlike dollar bill sized wallet. It is okay for credit card sized objects, but that's it. After 18 months and the stitching has separated. Admittedly it was over filled. I will either buy 2 of these or 2 other wallets. I need something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R.

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this a lot. It's nice and slim and barely noticeable in my front pocket. The wallet comfortably holds 6 cards and some cash. I will say that the middle "cash" pocket can comfortably hold about 5 folded bills. Anything more than that and it gets too snug. I don't carry much cash anyway so this is not a big deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: ansky

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I have this a few months now and it has been fantastic! I love the small profile when it's in my pocket. I always put my wallet in the front pocket and a regular wallet was bulky but this is almost like nothing. Also leaves room to still put my phone in the small pocket and it not feel stuffed. Downside is you can't hold as many cards, so I had to make some cuts, and you can't hold as many bills. Otherwise everything stays in nice and snug(already so far), but I can't comment on the RFID blocking since I have no idea if it's blocking some stranger from reading...
customer_reviews.author: Blitz XLII

customer_reviews.title: Too small for normal use and one of the card sleeves too lose within 2 months of normal use
customer_reviews.text: Credit card sleeves too lose after 2 months of use. Credit card falls without any effort by simply moving wallet on the side (opening facing down). Also the size is good for 4 cards on the side sleeves, drivers license and insurance card on either side inside inner sleeve and couple $20/etc bills in the very center. No additional space whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Atiq U. Malik

customer_reviews.title: Very minimal but fits all my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to get a smaller wallet and was getting paranoid carrying my wallet in my back pocket all of the time especially in crowds. This had plenty of space for my cards and money and kept everything very compact. I was surprised at how flat this is and I even have room for 1 or 2 more cards. Helps to get rid of all that clutter too.
customer_reviews.author: Terence

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size. Fits 8 cards + small bills.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Fits 8 cards and some small bills easily. Would purchase again. However, I'm not too sure about the RFID, as I have no way to measure / test that part. So glad to downsize wallet to this + purchases phone case that holds license and a few Credit Cards.
customer_reviews.author: Phil and Alex

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for. Had to pull ...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Had to pull out a few id cards, etc but this wallet does the job just right. Couple of months now of daily use, no sign of wear. After over a year the wallet is doing well, exterior looks almost brand new. But the fabric separators on a couple of the inside pockets has come loose. Still not bad for the price but impairs the functionality a bit. May try to stitch it or glue it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Demarsh

customer_reviews.title: Great mini wallet, can't fit a lot of cash in it
customer_reviews.text: The wallet is nice and compact. My cards haven't slipped out yet after many months, which is a good sign. I have no idea about the RFID blocking, so I cannot comment on the effectiveness of that feature. One thing I noticed though, is that I can't comfortably fit as many bills as others claim. If I try, the wallet is way too tight and it's a struggle to remove anything. I don't really carry much cash anyway, but if I needed to for whatever reason, this is not the wallet I'd use. However, for general purpose, it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Sav

customer_reviews.title: Slim and well made
customer_reviews.text: This wallet has plenty of room for my handful of cards and currency. I currently have eight cards and several bills stored away in mine and it adds almost no bulk to my pocket. It is thinner than my phone even despite having everything in it and the RFID blocking is a nice touch now that my cards are starting to go pin and chip. I'd highly recommend it for someone looking to get a slim wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Blaise Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Pocket and Lining Ripped and Stitching Failed After 6 months. Strong Odor of Formaldehyde.
customer_reviews.text: When opening the packaging, my first thought was, "Oh God, what is that smell? And is this wallet real leather?" The wallet had a strong formaldehyde smell that took about a month to dissipate. I would have sent it back, but I had destroyed my previous wallet in the laundry and needed a wallet immediately. The top edges of the credit card pockets are folded, but not sewn. After 6 months, the leather ripped at the top of one of the pockets. Then the nylon lining came undone. I recommend spending a little more for a better constructed and more durable wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Trident Gum

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet, not fully blocked RFID.
customer_reviews.text: The RFID blocking is not as good as I had hoped, I use RFID cards at work, and it can easily read through the wallet, it did reduce the range but did not block it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: Misleading information in item description, it is not made of leather
customer_reviews.text: The wallet (purchased from "Value On Style Store", and fulfilled via Amazon) is NOT genuine leather, it is plastic. Not sure if I got a fake one somehow, but the packaging looks legit. In any case, the wallet is very cheaply made of synthetic materials, not leather, so I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: A terrific product, especially at the price
customer_reviews.text: A terrific product, especially at the price. I was worried about not being able to carry all the cards I used to carry (but hardly ever used), but so after (after two months of use), I have never needed any of those cards (which I now leave in my car just in case). I still carry all my credit cards, driver's license, NEXUS cards (both mine and my wife's), several medical identity cards, and about $100 cash. And with the RFID, I don't have to worry about having my cell phone in the same pocket with magnetic strip cards. All in all, I am extremely happy with my new ultra-slim wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Beall

customer_reviews.title: Still Using It After 3 Years
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the minimalist look and small footprint of this wallet. 3 Years ago I purchased one for $15 and it was definitely a worthwhile investment. I'm still using mine everyday 3 years later and aside from some signs of wear it is good as new. I can hold up to 8 cards with a few small business cards and some cash comfortably in this wallet. If you want a wallet that wont feel bulky but can still hold a good amount of stuff you will enjoy this one by Hammer Anvil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT IS COMPACT
customer_reviews.text: If small and compact is beautiful this is lovely. I've used it since it came and the only problem is getting money into and out of it. You must fold the money and it often does not go in smoothly or come out easily. It does do the job but you do pay a price for the small size. All in all it is what I expected and I'm satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: It's A Great Minimalist Mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good minimalist wallet. I have used it for about 4 years and it is still going. I was able to place 6 cards inside it with about 6 bills without making it too bulky. I used this wallet in my front pocket with out a problem and I never felt it stick out.
customer_reviews.author: ElegantEngineer

customer_reviews.title: I was tired of carrying a fat wallet. (Updated important)
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet. I carry 4-5 cards and this fits me perfect. Now, I dont carry a lot of cash so if you do, be aware. It is good for a few bills but anything over 7-8 might be excessive. It fits everything I need. And it hasn't gotten "loose" UPDATE: Pockets have ripped. The cards fit in the pocket and you can see through the other sides. Was a great wallet, but poorly made. I only keep about 4-5 cards. So it could not handle that. BE AWARE
customer_reviews.author: M8242

customer_reviews.title: Best wallet I’ve ever had
customer_reviews.text: Best wallet I’ve ever had. Nice and thin, and after it’s broken in, money easily fits in the center money pocket. The first one I owned lasted me about 2 years and quickly ordered another one. This time in the slick looking blue color. I will definitely order another one if the new one every goes bad. *I cannot attest to the RFID blocking feature as I have not tested it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a folding leather wallet
customer_reviews.text: I had a "normal" folding leather wallet for years. I put everything from my old wallet into this one. With all my stuff, this wallet was still slimmer than my empty old wallet. Stitching/leather seems legit. The color is good (I have crosshatch grey). I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: ... few months now and I gotta say it is amazing. I was getting tired of having a "brick" ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this wallet for a few months now and I gotta say it is amazing. I was getting tired of having a "brick" in my back pocket and the slimmest and minimalistic nature if this wallet have eased my concerns about having a wallet. Every compartment is easily available and it keeps your bills flat and folded, so you don't have to worry about flattening or crumpleness. Taking out of the pocket is easy and fast compared to having to struggle with the clunky "whales" I had before. Do yourself and your pants a favor and invest in one of these, you'll never look back.
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet!!
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the slimness of this wallet and it looks very sleek and professional. The materials feel good and the branding isn’t too out there so it’s very minimal. My only complaint is the inner stitching of the wallet comes loose very easily on both wallets I’ve purchased so it seems pretty easy to tear but other than that I enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Simple. Good Quality Slim Wallet
customer_reviews.text: Quality seems very good. Holds the equivalent of 4 credit cards plus a driver's license and a few cash bills. Anything in excess of that and it starts to be too snug. Great value. Thumbs up. UPDATE: beware of mediocre quality. After about two months of daily use the stitching is beginning to become loose in a couple of places.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: does a nice job in holding your cards
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to wait on my review until I had some time to put this wallet to the test. It's made of high quality leather, does a nice job in holding your cards, however, it does stretch a little more than I would like. For instance, if you put two cards into a slot, it will stretch to the point where it is too loose and a card may come out inadvertently. I'm not talking about sticking two credit cards, more a credit card and a business card. In any event, good quality product, just be advised that sticking anything more than one card in each slot will stretch the slot out more than I think you'd like.
customer_reviews.author: John From Boston

customer_reviews.title: Small, Slim wallet, perfect for a couple of cards, not if you have a lot of cards and cash
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet, and its very slim and easy to carry around or put into a pocket. PROS: -Small -Slim -The Leather is nicely made CONS: -Because it's so slim, its difficult to put more than about 10 cards in there, and if you have more, things get really really tight -Sometimes its very difficult to pull out cash, and a traditional wallet is much better in terms of that. If you have a couple cards you carry with you, but not a lot of cash, this wallet is perfect for you
customer_reviews.author: B. Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Well made, slim and minimal, exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Well made wallet. Exactly what I was looking for. Very slim and minimal wallet yet still holds 6 plastic cards and some cash. I like the RF protection as more and more cards include RF chips. My back is especially appreciative for not having to sit on such a large bulky wallet. Funny story, my back was actually sore for the first few days of using this wallet because its so thin that my sitting position is no longer skewed to one side. I think my back muscles have gotten so use to sitting crooked that it took a bit of getting used to sitting straight again.
customer_reviews.author: CVRM

customer_reviews.title: Great little wallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality little wallet. I went from a full sized folding wallet to this and LOVE it. If you carry a lot of notes it can get cramped but fits everything I need. The card slot are loose enough it's easy to get cards in and out but snug enough nothing has ever fallen out. This was AMAZING value for money. UPDATE: I've had this wallet for about 15 months now and the liner connecting one of the card pockets has broken. For $10 it's a lovely wallet and I'm actually about to order a new one as a replacement, love it.
customer_reviews.author: GingaskunkTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good for a minimalist
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the wallet is nice but the wallet is a bit too tight and small. If you have a couple cards in it you can not fit much cash in it if any at all. My buisness cards dont fit very well they are extremely tight to get in it. Forget having a few cards plus cash. But hey the quality is nice
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Compact - seems well made and lots of pockets
customer_reviews.text: I got this to hold the fraction of the cards, etc. that I carry in my main wallet. Most days I don't need most of what is in my main wallet, and this is a great lightweight alternative for the essentials. My wife saw mine and asked for one for her, for her travel mini-purse. Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.author: WileEC

customer_reviews.title: 3 Years and Going Strong!
customer_reviews.text: DEFINITE YES. This has been my main wallet for going on 3 years now. Solid quality product that cannot be beat for the price. Over the years, I've let it sit on wet counter tops, dropped it, and put it through hours of contact when I'm carrying it on me, and it has still held up. I'm sure there are fancier leather wallets on the market, but for the price you get a clean, sleek black wallet that will fit your minimalist lifestyle. Very slim. Also great wallet option for petite females that may have slightly smaller pockets on them, and have never run into any issues with bulk.
customer_reviews.author: CityGooner

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Slick!!
customer_reviews.text: it holds 2 credit cards, 2 IDs, 2 med cards, my biz cards, and enough bills to make me confident in an emergency. It's a joy every time I pull it out of my pocket. I can just slightly slip an ID card out to swipe an entrance door, without taking it out completely. The cards can be stair-stepped, so you can grab either one easily. It looks cool when it's out on a desk. And the price is great. I love it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Time/Space Fabrics

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Though I can't vouch for the RFID blocking capabilities of this item it is a quality item. Made of great materials and slim just like I wanted. Using a regular bifold wallet my whole life has only added to my back pain and this wallet is helped so much in that. Always have to check to be sure it's still in my pocket cause it's so thin. 3 cards one side, 3 cards on the other side with insurance cards and usually keep 2-3 bills in the center and I like it.
customer_reviews.author: NottaReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great, usable, thin wallet
customer_reviews.text: This wallet was exactly what I was looking for. It fits 8-10 cards perfectly while still being able to get cards in and out easily. The middle cash section is also easier to access than other wallets I've had. It's a tad larger than I expected but that little bit of extra size makes it work all the better. Well made and seems like it will hold up well, I've only been using it for a month so far.
customer_reviews.author: D. Neu

customer_reviews.title: Finally found what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for four months now and little to no wear on the leather and still seems like it is brand new, even though it is ALWAYS in my right front pocket. It is everything I wanted in a front pocket wallet and more. The amount of cards, ID's and cash I can carry in such a small foot print is astounding. If you've been waiting to find something to contain a bunch of loose things in your front pocket, or wish to not have a lumpy butt cheek when wearing slacks or jeans, this is exactly what you need. The RFID capability is just icing on the cake!
customer_reviews.author: derekl999

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price! :)
customer_reviews.text: This is what I was looking for. Nice leather, cards fit in nicely without being super snug and it's nice and affordable, super thin too! I have 7 cards as opposed to the suggested 6 and have no stretching or bulging in the wallet. I have noticed cash is a pain to put in and out, but then again, do you want it easy for it to fall out? Nope! So all in all 5 of 5. Can't be too picky for the price. The packaging, feels like Christmas when I open it.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Good conversion wallet
customer_reviews.text: Have had for a couple years. My conversion from a typical wallet. Different from a normal wallet (I shove my cash in sometimes, but I've gotten more used to folding it in half). Keeps it nice and slim for what's inserted. Has shown some wear, but I'll probably buy another one in a year or so if it doesn't hold up. For the price, can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: oioi123

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of my Costanza wallet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wallet. It's small and fits in my front pocket easily. The threads on it did come loose and Hammer Anvil sent me a new one. Very easy to work with. Will not hesitate to buy from them again. I fit all my cards and cash easily. It's stiff at first, but after about a week of use, it becomes easier to remove the cards and cash. One thing I did on the new wallet was to add some fray check to spots in the stitching looked like it would come undone due to use. I am not sure how much this will help, but I don't think it will hurt.
customer_reviews.author: feeble

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and simple
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my boyfriend. He used to have the huge trifold wallets (yawn!) He loves it. It is 1/4 the thickness of his old wallet and it still holds all the essentials that he needs. Pros: Sleek, simple, and plenty of compartments. The stitching is nice and even with no raw edges. Cons: If you put too much stuff in there the wallet starts to bow out on both sides and slightly bends (rounds out) your cards. This is wallet is great for any man that wants to reduce wallet clutter. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Persia C.

customer_reviews.title: WAAAAY too "skinny" to be useful
customer_reviews.text: Wallet is so thin that very little fits inside. Maybe three credit cards and a few business cards, but pocket is useless for bills, which won't fit, even folded in half. They extend outside the pocket. Canadian bills, being plastic, do not fold well, either, so this is not a good solution. Very disappointed, as this was a Christmas gift for my husband, and he won't use it. Would it stretch out enough with use? I'll probably never know, because it won't be used. Unfortunately, it is not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Great wallet. It's a bit stiff and so taking ...
customer_reviews.text: Great wallet. It's a bit stiff and so taking cards out was a bit difficult at first before I got used to it. But it's a very low profile wallet so it can be used with a variety of clothes without a weird bulge in your pockets. The RFID blocking features doesn't seem to work though. I use this to hold my work ID card, and I can still gain entry without having to pull the card out of my wallet. This doesn't bother me, as that's not why I bought the wallet. But for anybody who's counting on this feature for ID security, I would highly suggest you test this out for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyButtDroppings

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this intending to see if I liked front-pocket wallets with the intent to buy a nicer one if I did, but find this to be completely adequate. Cash is hard to get into it, but I tend to not carry a lot of that.
customer_reviews.author: Thecal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Lightweight, and Compact
customer_reviews.text: A sturdy, lightweight, and compact wallet that I must say I adore. While I haven't tested out the RFID blocking capabilities, the fact that I've gone from that guy with the big fat wallet to barely even noticing it most of the time - seriously, I have to check sometimes - is enough for me. I've had it since May 2017, it's still going strong, and I look forward to using it everyday until I have to buy a new one - which is a great value too.
customer_reviews.author: 4ofjulyguy

customer_reviews.title: Its works
customer_reviews.text: This is the third slim wallet I have purchased in my life and it is just okay. I like designs that maximizes small in all areas. This is great when it comes to thickness. It could be changed when it comes to height. The place where $ cash goes sticks out to much
customer_reviews.author: UTAH Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great
customer_reviews.text: A wonderfully simple product. Not much one could complain about here. Design is functional and it looks quite nice and unassuming. The cash pocket is designed great. My only gripe is the material really grips the cards but I suppose that's what I want considering they are pockets and not closed systems. I definitely do a lot of fiddling around to release my cards from its death grip. But it's a much better complaint to have than it's dropping my cards all over the floor. 5/5 one of the better slim wallets available no doubt
customer_reviews.author: Teddy

customer_reviews.title: a lot thinner at the start but pretty much the same result (also tore up my credit ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had several wallets over the years. The standard fold-over one of course: thick, bulky, put much it in and your left with a rock in your pocket basically. I gave a metal plate wallet a chance, 3 plates held together with glorified rubber bands, a lot thinner at the start but pretty much the same result (also tore up my credit cards). This wallet is nice and light, not a ton of slots for cards but doubling up doesn't seem to stretch it or stress my cards out. Really unnoticeable compared to my old wallets in my pocket, still check every now and then just to make sure it's there.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: A Compact Wallet For The Real World
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I started carrying a smartphone, I've been searching for a good small wallet. I tried a couple, but they weren't functional. They packed credit cards together. That meant fumbling to slide out the right card every time I paid for something, then fumbling again to slide it back in the pack. Not fun. This lightweight wallet does it right. Each card has its own slot, and the middle section holds a few bills. My search is over.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Follek

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice, Slim Wallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality product - Made in USA. The leather and stitching appear very durable. I can't speak to how well the RFID blocking works since I don't carry transmitters around in my wallet, and I can think of no equipment that can scan (from a distance) an inert chip. If my card issuers begin shipping transmitters with their product, I'll just keep them under my tin foil hat. June 2, 2019 Update Still going strong - 3 years and counting!
customer_reviews.author: John Ashton

customer_reviews.title: I was so pleased with this product at first
customer_reviews.text: I was so pleased with this product at first, but it couldn't even last a year before it started falling apart. So the outside is leather, but the inside has maybe around 4 layers of different fabrics. Each layer continued to get unsewn until i was left with something that I can't really use... it is too flimsy now and difficult to put my money in because even though I cut the layers out, it was difficult to get the very last part of each material/fabric towards the bottom of the wallet and it becomes all clumpy. Very disappointed... really liked this wallet in the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: It works! And I've been pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: A few months a go I had a run in with someone on the NYC subway skimming my RFID credit card. They'd give me a new one and a few days later cancel the card and Give me a new one. This went on for a few weeks. Enough already! I knew i had to take things into my own hands! Cue the Hammer Anvil RFID wallet. I tried a few things and it doesn't read the RFID of my credit cards, But still allows my work RFID cards to transmit, Which is exactly what I wanted! It also looks nice to boot! Make sure it blocks the bands you need and you should be golden!
customer_reviews.author: SeveNx7

customer_reviews.title: Great work wallet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to store my company card separately from my personal ones (and to keep some business cards handy). It’s sleek and thin, which is exactly what I was looking for. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Tay

customer_reviews.title: Slim wallet for cards
customer_reviews.text: This is a very very slim and small wallet however I will only use it if I'm carrying little to no cash. It is very difficult to get even 3 - 5 bills in or out of the wallet even if you only have 3 or 4 cards in it. It's a nice wallet if you are only carrying a few cards.
customer_reviews.author: JN

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Anvil RFID Blocking Minimalist Genuine wallet
customer_reviews.text: Ron's wife here. I bought this for my husband since he wasn't carrying his wallet with him since it was too thick. (not with money) Since he mainly needed his drivers license and a credit card this is perfect. He likes it and is better about carrying his license with him now.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the best wallet I've owned
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my new wallet. Holy crap, I thought my old wallet was small and out of the way, but this one makes my other feel like I had a text book in my back pocket. I would recommend this wallet for anyone who doesn't have a ton of crap in their wallet and wants to keep things simple. I currently have about one to two cards in each of the four pockets and then about 6 bills in the pocket for cash. I don't think I would dare do any more in that though.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: As Far As Wallet Goes....
customer_reviews.text: It's a great wallet for men who likes small compact wallet. Boyfriend is very happy with it. I don't know about RFID blocking and now well that's working, but as a wallet, it's a good one.
customer_reviews.author: misaki

customer_reviews.title: The web page called it a "money clip" and this ...
customer_reviews.text: The web page called it a "money clip" and this is not a money clip. I expected that it was open at one end with a clip in the center fold to tuck the bills behind, but no such luck. This is sewn shut at both ends and you have to slide your folded up money into the very tight center pocket, which severely limits the amount of money that it can carry. Perhaps the leather will stretch over time but as it is now it is very difficult to fit paper money into it. You should not call it a money clip because it gives the buyer the wrong expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect downsizing wallet
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to downsize. Handles 6 credit cards and some cash in 1/4 of the space of wallets I've had in the past. Well made. Mine is 5 years old and no obvious signs of wear. I just bought one for my wife and a backup for the future.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: After 1 month of use...still great!
customer_reviews.text: Well, compared to my previous methods of a fat wallet and then just pocketing a few cards for the day...it is a nice alternative. It feels a little wide in the pocket, but conforms well enough due to the soft leather. Great organizer for the few cards I do carry. It is a little difficult to get cards unless you pull back the leather. Unfortunately that will cause wear on the wallet over time, but until then it means the cards aren't falling out. Cash pocket in the middle works very well, but don't expect to fit anymore than 5 bills without stretching the wallet. Not sure the quality of RFID as I have no means to test.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would rather have a real wallet
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my teen, thinking he didn't need a bulky wallet. However, his money seems so exposed in it, and it is more of a hassle to fold. So, I think a real wallet would have been more useful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hammer Anvil minimalist wallet. Both times the inside fabric has torn within the first month. Also, after a month or so, when I turn the wallet upside down, it's not firm enough to hold my credit cards in place. I wanted to love this wallet, but unfortunately it didn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: He was really pleased and impressed with how thin this wallet is
customer_reviews.text: I gave it to my husband as a gift and he couldn't quit thanking me enough! He hates the regular bulky style wallets. He was really pleased and impressed with how thin this wallet is, yet has so many slots available for all of his necessities. He was also liked the fact that there isn't any cheap plastic on the wallet like other thin wallets have. The plastic tends to rip easy and make the wallet look less than desirable and unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Bum

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Below is a list of what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Much thinner than my previous [bi-fold] wallet. Good quality. Below is a list of what I am able to carry in the wallet. On the side with the Hammer Anvil emblem First slot: credit card and debit card Second slot: driver's license and student ID Pocket: medical insurance card, blood donor card, EMT certification, BLS certification (paper), first aid certification (paper) On the reverse side First slot: one or two prepaid cards Second slot: library card Pocket: two gift cards Large pocket: six bills (folded in half) I can still fit a few more bills into the pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: This one is probably the best sized front pocket wallet I've seen or owned
customer_reviews.text: This one is probably the best sized front pocket wallet I've seen or owned. This is slightly wider than the others so that bills folded in half don't stick out of the main pocket and barely show in the other two side pockets. The four credit card slots hold eight or more if you wanted but if you do then you should get a bigger wallet. For the front pocket this one's perfect, and the leather's of good quality and should hold up for a long time. Get one of these if you're disappointed with one of the others.
customer_reviews.author: Aberjoe

customer_reviews.title: Unisex Minimalistic Walle
customer_reviews.text: I took awhile to review this so I could see how it stood up over some time. Nice wallet, small, holds more cards than there are slots without a problem (it'll break in). I'll never go back to a bi-fold or tru-fold wallet, again. Minimalistic and keeps you from sitting on some large piece of cowhide. Love it. Wife even carries one - and she isn't manly....she would just leave her purse or wallet in baskets a but no more! Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Carries my essentials. Compact and stylish.
customer_reviews.text: It's a minimalist wallet. Compact. When I first got it, it was actually difficult to get cards and cash into it but the leather has loosened up a very tiny bit to allow cards to slide in more easily. Ideally you'd have 3 cards in it: license, credit card, and cash—but I carry 9 essential "cards" but it still functions very well. Love the color, I lose track of it less at home.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: These fall apart.
customer_reviews.text: Very sad to report that this wallet falls apart within a couple months. It seems very nice and I thought maybe I rec'd a one off bad wallet, but after ordering a second and it falling apart, I have come to the conclusion that it is just poor quality leather. Too bad as it is a nice compact design.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably fits 10 notes
customer_reviews.text: Got this because my other wallet was too thick and exacerbated my back problems. So far, it's been solid. Try not to keep too much cash on hand. Comfortably fits 10 notes, 4 credit cards and 2 I.D.'s. I imagine for the price, the longevity may be questionable, but so far (2 months) none of the threads have pulled.
customer_reviews.author: de la vega

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, great price, would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I really love this wallet. I started carrying my traditional wallet in my front pocket to keep from hip issues. I found this wallet on a list for cheap but quality items on amazon. I ordered and have had it for several months and can recommend. It still is in great shape and I never want to go back to a traditional wallet. It has a nice slot in the center for cash and holds several cards.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Sleek
customer_reviews.text: The thin minimalist wallet makes you think what you want to carry. This is sturdy and simple, thin yet with a lot of room, I recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pascual

customer_reviews.title: Best card holder ever!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't carried a wallet for 15 years because I didn't want to have back problems. For the past 10 years, I have kept my credit cards, drivers license and insurance cards in a sleeve that was sort sort of heavy-duty woven material that finally started giving up and it really didn't look too professional. I was looking for something that had a thin profile, could hold 4-6 cards and cash. This case was EXACTLY what I was looking for. The size is perfect to fit in my front pocket. The price was also right on this item - a great buy for a real, leather product. I expect this to last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: loudmacleod

customer_reviews.title: not leather.  seams are tearing.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed that the wallet was not leather. It's definitely vinyl. I was going to just deal with it, because I liked the fit/size/etc, but now it's coming apart at the seams. I don't have too many cards in there, I don't like a thick wallet. I think it's just not great quality. I'll be trying a different brand for my next wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Cymrix

customer_reviews.title: Good wallet just not what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Nice slim wallet- I got a couple to test the different styles and ended up going with the slimfokd wgich, in my opinion, the best wallet out there.
customer_reviews.author: Anders Gilstad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Everything fits very tightly, which is great for a slim wallet. No real possibility of anything falling out, even if you over stuff every once in a while. I imagine though if you keep doing it, it will stretch out, thus giving a need for a larger wallet, thus negating the reason for buying this in the first place. Perfect for front pocket fit. Small enough that you might not even remember that it's there!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good minimalist wallet that wont take up room in your pocket -- but RFID blocking not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This is a good wallet and I'm pretty happy. I do wish this newer model was *not* RFID blocking, as it's an inconvenience to have to pull my transit card out each time I use it. (The previous model was not RFID blocking, so I could just wave my wallet at the fare reader on the bus or train.) But overall this is a good, useful wallet that doesn't take up too much room in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Josh N

customer_reviews.title: A little small for my liking, but not too ...
customer_reviews.text: A little small for my liking, but not too much of an issue. A very well made item, I did immediately notice the quality put into it. If it was a bit bigger, would be a five star rating. Get it if you do not mind a smaller wallet. Maybe I will get used to it. I would not consider sending it back, and will keep using it, but still wish it was a bit bigger. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: David G. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good wallet, but the design needs work.
customer_reviews.text: The materials seem good but the fact that the card sections is more narrow than the bill section means the wallet is thinner at one point and tends to bend and fold there, which is a bit distracting and makes me worry all the time if it's going to last. I sometimes think about it as I'm digging it out of my pocket, or as I put it back in, making sure that part isn't folded over. A wallet isn't something you should have to think about.
customer_reviews.author: Hellified
